Service workers essentially act as proxy servers that sit between web apps, and the browser and network. They are event-driven, and can control the web page/site it is associated with, intercepting and modifying navigation and resource requests, and caching resources. SW may decrease performance depending on the script that is running in background. So overall, disabling SW should enhance performance because it blocks SW Scripts.
Service worker APIs are hidden (in Firefox) and cannot be used when in PB mode.
Service workers only run over HTTPS. Service Workers have no DOM access.
